author: jochembrouwer
content: I think the main point is: DUPN1 - DUPN16 will simply not get deployed at all. Compilers will optimize this out. This seems (for me) like a waste of bytecode space

author: _shemnon
content: Don't forget gas golfing for size.  As long as we charge for gas by the byte for creates or limit sub containers to 16 bits of size.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Exactly, so also for deployment: for DUP/SWAP1-16 we save 200 gas for deployment bytes. I think this is a good argument to bump DUPN/SWAPN with 16 bytes
